description:
Finally, the sandboxing issues are resolved and this version is
completely compatible with OS X Mountain Lion.
features.title: Full support for OS X Mountain Lion.

description:
You'll be seeing an alert from within Mail.app if a new version of GPGMail
is available.

You can choose between different types of releases:
  • nightly: each development build will appear as an update
  • pre-release: alpha and beta builds will appear as an update
  • stable: only stable builds will appear as an update (requires upcoming GPGPreferences)
features.title: Added Sparkle update support on Mountain Lion

description: Each error message you'll see includes some hint on how to fix it.

If GPGMail can't handle an error, you'll see some detailed information from
the underlying gnupg engine, which you can post on our support forum.
That will help us to find a solution much quicker.
features.title: Proper error handling of encryption or signing failures.

description: Previously the OS X sandbox didn't allow GPGMail to access the config files.
Config files are saved outside of the sandbox as they were on Lion.
features.title: Defaults, gpg.conf and gpg-agent.conf are now parsed again on Mountain Lion

description:
The security indicator on the upper right side of the composer window
allows you to choose between using OpenPGP or S/MIME.
We've added handy shortcuts to switch between them quickly.

When either sign or encrypt is enabled, the security indicator will change color,
from grey to green.
features.title: Support seamless switching between S/MIME and OpenPGP

description:
You can use the groups feature of the gpg.conf to map a specific address (e.g. mailing list)
to a specific key.
features.title: Support for groups in gpg.conf

description: Show a preview of your encrypted message in the Mail.app list preview (2nd column).
Choose whether you want to create these previews in the GPGMail preference pane.
features.title: Create list preview snippets.

description: Select the correct secret key to use from the "From: " drop down.
For each available key the key id is displayed so it's easy to spot the right key.
features.title: Support the selection of the secret key to use if more than one exists for the same address

description:
When hovering over one of the encrypt or sign buttons in the composer window,
a message is now displayed, explaining why encryption or signing is not possible.

For example if the public key is missing, or no secret key for the from address
could be found.
features.title: Display hints why encryption or signing might not be possible

fixes: User choice for encrypt/sign status always sticks now.
Better installation handling.
Added all UUIDs since 10.7.0.
FlippedView error message is no longer shown in Console.
Version string is no longer cut off in the GPGMail preference pane.
The signature view now shows the creation date of the signature.
A huge bunch of fixes
So crazy much
It's not even real how much is in there...
Disables excessive logging which might have written sensitive information to /var/log/system.log* in some cases.
Just another update that fixes some issues and enhances the stability
Special binary-only Xmas Release 2011 for 10.7
Enhanced the stability a lot, not introduced new features
Still alpha quality (e.g. missing error messages)
Fourth alpha for 10.7
Closed 38 tickets
Submitted 65 commits, 119 files changed, 6675 insertions, 3461 deletions
Third alpha for 10.7
Second alpha for 10.7
Fixed over 50 major and minor issues
First alpha for 10.7
